oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Benefit at the Grand Ole Opry - 1978-08-30 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Hank Snow Benefit Concert at the Grand Ole Opry. The segment is hosted by T. Tommy Cutrer (musician) and features performances by: Hank Snow (musician), Kelly Foxton (musician), Opry Stage Band (musicial group), Riders in the Sky (musical group), Roy Rogers (musician), and Dale Evans (musician). The recording is from August 30, 1978. The tape is part three of four.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: T. Tommy Cutrer; Hank Snow; Kelly Foxton; Opry Stage Band; Riders in the Sky; Roy Rogers; Dale Evans
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Lay a Little Lovin' on Me (Hank Snow and Kelly Foxton) -- (02:40) Cry (Hank Snow and Kelly Foxton) -- (05:52) Hank Snow invites Kelly Foxton back on to the stage -- (06:43) I Dreamed of an Old Love Affair Lay a Little Lovin' on Me (Hank Snow and Kelly Foxton) -- (09:20) Unidentified tune (Opry Stage Band) -- (09:29) Snow introduces Foxton's family and praises Foxton -- (10:46) Unidentified hymn (Hank Snow) -- (14:00) I've Been Everywhere (Hank Snow) -- (16:40) Unidentified tune (Opry Stage Band) -- (17:20) Snow reflects on the accompanying band -- (18:26) Blue Shadows on the Trail (Riders in the Sky) -- (22:16) Doug Green introduces the band -- (22:55) When Payday Rolls Around (Riders in the Sky) -- (24:52) Cutrer remembers a story about a bow tie and introduces Roy Rogers -- (27:18) Rogers expresses his thanks for the Grand Ole Opry -- (29:43) Texas Plains (Roy Rogers) -- (31:52) Rogers reflects on his museum and his age -- (35:54) Hoppy, Gene and Me (Roy Rogers) -- (38:45) Rogers inquires about the Texan members in the audience and introduces Dale Evans; additionally, Evans reflects on her career in Nashville and Jesus -- (47:11) Satisfaction Guaranteed (Dale Evans) -- (51:11) Evans reflects on a child who had been abused -- (54:12) Mother's Prayer (Dale Evans) -- (58:33) Evans invites Rogers back on the stage to perform -- (59:19) The Heart of the Country is the Home (Roy Rogers and Dale Evans) -- (1:02:04) Cutrer interrupts the show to introduce sheriff Bate Thomas (unconfirmed) to discuss abused children -- (1:04:34) Happy Trails to You (Roy Rogers and Dale Evans) -- (1:05:32) Cutrer thanks Evans, Rogers and the other performers -- (1:07:13) I Saw the Light [incomplete] (Roy Rogers and Dale Evans)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cutrer, T. Tommy; Snow, Hank; Foxton, Kelly; Opry Stage Band; Riders in the Sky; Rogers, Roy, 1911-1998; Evans, Dale, 1912-2001;
